alert.note: Alert for Allen; East Cameron; Evangeline; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Upper Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 5:58AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CAMERON...JEFFERSON DAVIS...EVANGELINE...ACADIA...SOUTHEASTERN CALCASIEU...WESTERN VERMILION...NORTHWESTERN ST. LANDRY AND EASTERN ALLEN PARISHES THROUGH 630 AM CST... At 557 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oakdale to near Elton to near Grand Chenier. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crowley, Eunice, Jennings, Oakdale, Ville Platte, Mamou, Welsh, Lake Arthur, Kinder, Basile, Oberlin, Iota, Gueydan, Elton, Mermentau, Turkey Creek, Rockefeller Wildlife Range, Hayes, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, and Pecan Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 48 and 86. Interstate 49 between mile markers 39 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Allen; East Cameron; Evangeline; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; St. Landry; Upper Vermilion
